title: Motel 6 Asheville North Carolina
text:
Unbelievable. This is a pet friendly motel. We arrived and settled in for the night with our 13 year old kitty. We were in the room maybe 45 minutes tops when we couldn’t find our cat. 
Flabbergasted, we looked everywhere in the room. I then saw a big hole in the wall under the bathroom sink. We were positive that’s where he went. But where? Did he fall into a basement and was he okay?
My boyfriend called the front desk in despair and asked for help. The very inexperienced front desk clerk said he did not know of any hole and would be right down. After fifteen minutes of waiting, my boyfriend started walking to the motel office where he met the desk clerk. Apparently the clerk was intimidated by my boyfriend ‘s looks. The clerk called the police and demanded us to vacate the premises WITHOUT OUR CAT. I refused. The cop was on our side but had to obey the property owner. My boyfriend and the cop found a way into the subfloor of the motel and found my kitty alive and well. 
We still had to leave with no refund. 
I have never been kicked out of a motel. I am 62 years old and am so appalled at this motels customer service 

We have received a refund but it is not enough compensation. We had to drive another two hours to find a pet friendly motel. We ended up at a motel 6 in Columbia, SC   If this motel chain can do no better than blame their local management for bad service, I recommend no one stay at a motel 6 unless you’re desperate

title: Maria hall
text: Maria was our salesperson and was very knowledgeable, friendly and considerate. Maria made our purchase easy and enjoyable. Management was a different story, I was trading in a ford fusion that I purchase at Butler Ford 2years ago and was a good experience. This purchase was not pleasant, management haggled with me on the price of my vehicle for at least 30 minutes trying to low ball me. When I got home the 2021 vehicle , after a closer inspection of the vehicle, I found both front wiper blades had no rubber on them and the rear blade also needed replaced, no windshield wiper fluid, and the oil was 2 quarts low. This tells me they did not even inspect this vehicle, they trued to sell the vehicle to me with a hatchback that needed adjusting, had to return a week later from roseburg so they could fix the problem in 15 minutes, 3 hours round trip. I will never purchase another vehicle from butler accura nor will any of my family members.

title: could be better
text: i’m a local municipal worker, so i use gps’ pretty much everyday. i switched to google maps a few years back because it was so much more efficient. over time it has got a lot worse. i loved the features it has; having multiple stops and being able to see your next few turns and street views of the location. although it still is decent, every time i put in an address now, it’ll pop up, but it sends me to a random part of the street and says i’ve arrived to the subdivision, and lists the address at the bottom; it doesn’t help at all. for example, i type in an address and i get to the middle of the street and it says i’ve arrived; the subdivision name pops up bold and list the address i was trying to get to at the bottom, and i’ve either already passed the house or it’s a few houses(or a few miles) down the road. i think this needs to be fixed because it definitely pisses me off having to look for the building/house even though i would assume this app is made to get you to the correct address/location. when typing the addresses in, it’ll automatically put the name of the subdivision instead of the address. take me to the house not the subdivision, it’s a drag looking for the place when the app should’ve taken you there in the first place! another bug that has come up recently is when putting multiple stops, it usually goes from stop ‘a’ to stop ‘j’ but after i put the location for the next to last stop, it marks my location as stop ‘j.’ please fix the issues.

title: Desperately want new feature, but still great
text: My boyfriend, and I would be so grateful if you’ll could add a feature that you can add an input of the time and/or day of your trip to get a more accurate prediction of the time a trip will take. For instance if you’re working somewhere different/new for your job on a frequent basis, and are planning for your work commute the night before, and enter the address you will only be able to get the time it takes to make that trip for whatever the current time is, instead of the time it will take when you leave the following day so times can vary wildly. Then you show up to work late the following day based upon your planning for the commute that you calculated the night before when traffic and other factors aren’t taken into account. I’m confident Google possesses the data, and the ability to add this feature with minimal time, and money and would be a great addition to the application.

title: I’m so disappointed with the app that used to be my number one.
text: 3 or 4 upgrades ago google maps app started to glitch out. Currently the only verbal directions I get are the first one or two turns when I start directions. After that it goes quiet. As I start driving the blue location dot never moves, just pulses. After driving 10-15 mins I look at the app and the screen is still at my original starting point. I can manually swipe the top directions to the left to see want to do next but it doesn’t update by itself from that point. One thing I noticed is that at the bottom of the app where it tells you your ETA, time adjusts accordingly even though the map is pretty much frozen. For example if I look at the screen it’s shows that I’m still at my house but the time puts me 8 minuets away from destination. I wish I would have never updated because I use this app for work and I can’t count on it anymore to get me where I need to go without freezing. I have been printing directions and hoping this issue gets resolved ASAP.

title: Seems ok
text:
I had thought that I preferred this to my already installed Apple Maps.  But after trying both on a recent longer trip, I found this one less reliable in traversing large cities.  First, it suddenly asked in the middle of 5 lanes going around ATL, if “I would like to change route—they found a better one.”  I had already chosen the best one to begin with. And if so, “press this or that.” I don’t have dashboard navigation.  I rely mainly on voice commands.  My iPad mini was lying on the seat beside me, and I couldn’t see or look long enough to answer.  I was in very heavy traffic.  It should give you a voice choice response.  I’m not sure if I was supposed to press if I wanted to change, or wanted to stay the course. It gave NO time, or any warning. Just a sudden interjection.    As a result, I seem to have been taken off my original route, but couldn’t deal with it, or change lanes/course with no warning. Honestly, unless there’s a compelling reason to suddenly change course, it really just needs to shut up.  

So as soon as I could get over, I took an exit, parked at a station and changed to the Apple one.  

The other gripe I had was that there’s very little warning for turns, or to get into other lanes.  My Apple Map seems to do a better job of that. Plenty of warning.  “Go thru THIS light,” etc.  
I still give anything this wonderful and convenient (voice navigation) 3 stars.  But I don’t think it will be my choice when traversing major unfamiliar cities.

title: Please consider relocating the Current Location button
text:
It is extremely disruptive when you are moving across the map with your fingers. Its position makes it do that you’ll be exploring some faraway place, and then if your finger so much as grazes the Current Location button, the map immediately zooms in on your current location. This is frustrating and unnecessary. Putting that button elsewhere, and/or shrinking its hot box, would save the user a lot of frustration. You could switch its place with that of the Directions button right below it. If accidentally pressed, the Directions button will not take the user away from the place of the map they are exploring. Still not ideal to keep touching it accidentally, but it shaves off about 60% of the disruption.

Please consider. There are a million things I can think of to make this product better (i.e., an option to avoid unprotected left turns as part of driving directions!), but this one would be the most innocuous, easiest to implement.

title: Tony C
text:
I am an Uber driver and I switch between Google maps which is configured to work with the Uber App and Waze because Google Maps driects me  to too many streets that are no longer available from my location. And many other other route issues.
It also directs me  to make right turns followed dangerous left turns through busy intersections where there are no traffic signals, in situations where if I had travel 1 block further, I would be able to make a right turn and then make the left turn at an intersection with a traffic signal. Too often on freeways it directs to an exit pass the exit directly on to my destination street or close to it, then I have to make at least 2 right turns to get back to the destination, which I already passed on to Freeway.
The biggest issue for me is in areas in Los Angeles when I have the option to enter 2 or more freeways with no clear indication of which Freeway I should take to get to the designated exit. 
Another problem is that the next turn or Freeway exit is not displayed constantly.

title: Please create feature to save/remember current trips
text:
I agree with an earlier reviewer about the sporadic use of ‘landmarks’ in the directions, rather than using only street names. It’s weird and arbitrary. Then it switches between giving directions in feet or fractions of a mile, or sometimes doesn’t give turn directions until it’s too late to safely execute the turn. Sometimes voice directions don’t come at all and I have to look at the phone while driving (!) to see what to do next.

Recently, the reminders to leave have not been coming through each time they are requested, which I rely on to plan my trips accordingly. Aggravating!

My main frustration with this app is that it erases open directions if I accidentally click out of the app or into it from a Notification, or when I’m editing stops but use the < arrow to back out. I frequently have trips with multiple stops, so losing my entire trip and starting from scratch is INFURIATING. If there was a way to save current trips or retrieve them, that would be so helpful!!!

title: New bug affecting saved lists since update
text:
There’s a new bug affecting saved lists. If I select a point on the map (not an already-identified location, like a store, but just a point with coordinates), I can save this point, add notes, with no issue. The expected behavior, which previously worked, was that you could later click this saved point (flag, heart, etc) in order to see and edit the notes made.
Now, there is a bug making this impossible, meaning I have hundreds of saved locations whose notes I cannot read. When I attempt to click the saved point on the map, I cannot select the point (and thus cannot see notes left for that point). It just creates a new point. I think this bug arose with the introduction of the “travel” blue suitcase point. The point and the notes all still exist (as you can see from accessing the entire list of saved locations), but the ability to click and select these points on the map is broken. Seems like a straightforward fix - hoping the maps team will identify and fix this issue for all those super users heavily reliant on saved locations.

title: Unintelligible and fickle instructions
text:
I am a user of Google as all of us beings in this internet world are. I use Chrome, Chromecast, and have for years used Maps reliably as my chosen app for navigation (on my iPhone.)

I have to highlight major points I saw in other reviews: 1. Walking navigation is a mess. I live and spend time in major cities, and have only seen this issue worsened here. When you try and center yourself, Google wants to tell you you’re two blocks away, or will try to orient you in a spinning wheel of cardinal directions. Choose your own. 

2. My major gripe and reason I’m switching to Waze is because I FEEL LIKE I AM ABOUT TO GET INTO AN ACCIDENT EVERYTIME I GRIP MY STEERING WHEEL. I commute many miles a day and I’ve been just horrified at how Google will suddenly re-route you. I thought I was going crazy reading the navigation wrong but it’s impossible now to deny that Google has sent me on wild goose chases on the interstate, through winding neighborhood streets for no reason, or simply just wants me to abruptly reverse my car to the prior exit on the highway that it didn’t want me to take 0.4 seconds ago but apparently now has somehow materialized in its periphery. It stresses. Me. Out.

title: Car Repair by Automedics in St Johns
text:
What a divine encounter! I was driving my 2003 car and the light came on for hot engine. I went to Auto Zone in St Johns for antifreeze. I was greeted by a very helpful gentleman. He replaced the antifreeze and noticed a leak. I stated I needed to take my car to a repair shop and he immediately referred me to Automedics. He spoke so highly of the quality of car repair they perform. He was basically kindly insisting that I have them look at my car prior to anyone else. Well, I called and all I can say is the service was equivalent to a valet. They drive me home once I dropped my car off and literally delivered my repaired car to my home!! How impressive is that!!!
Along with the fact that they send you an electronic breakdown of needed repairs to your phone or email. It’s so wonderful to experience such hands on customer service. I highly recommend them. Automedics will be my ongoing car service repair shop.

title: And I know celestial navigation!
text:
Being a bit of a nerd, and having studied spherical trigonometry, my love of sailing led me to teach myself celestial navigation.  It was a blast, but not really practical unless you’re well out on the sea…. And totally useless in a strange city driving a rented Ford Explorer!

So my little sister told me about Google Maps!  It has changed my nagavational life…. Honestly, how did we do it before Google maps??  There is nowhere I can’t go now.  I can always find my destination, and more importantly, always find my way back home afterwards!   Of all the apps I use on a day to day basis, absolutely nothing is as useful and effective as Google Maps.  Nothing!   I even have my cell phone set up where Google maps speaks to me in a sexy English accent, and comes directly through my hearing aids for hands-free operation!

I can offer no suggestions or ideas to improve this app.

title: Overcharged for a 10 x 15 unit that wasn’t full size
text: I was given a corner unit and had signed all the paperwork.  The movers were on the clock and I had driven 14 hours the day before to reach my destination.  We went ahead and moved everything into the unit because I was beyond exhausted.  I went back and talked to the storage manager and she said they considered that a 10 x 15 even though it wasn’t a full size.  She asked me if I wanted to bring the movers back when another unit became available.  I said no but I didn’t think I should be charged the full price.  She said that was company policy.   I went in there other times to talk to her and witnessed her being rude to people.  I just found out she got promoted to District Manager but I have no idea how.  When I moved out of my unit I again complained about the size and the gentleman working there gave me a partial month credit.  I have this in writing.  Storage Sense is refusing to honor the credit.  Its been almost a month and I can’t get a name of anyone at Corporate to talk to.  I’m trying to figure out my next step right now.

title: Improvements
text: I wish there was a way via iPhone to search bookmarks differently. I want to be able to zoom in an area on the map and have a list of just THOSE bookmarked places. I also want to be able to categorize them. Country, state/providence/food/activity.. and so on. And it would be nice to to be able to hide bookmarks. I hate showing someone my phone and have to explain ignore all of that. Also wish there was an option to just click a spot or long hold a spot while in route to add another destination or to see how long it would be to add another place with out having to do the whole search a place then “add stop”. It would also be nice to know right then how long total the trip would be with the added spots but also then how long it would be until your next destination with out having to click overview. Also adding locations needs to be improved I’ve tried adding a gas station to another country like 6 times and it keeps getting denied... why?! It’s a gas station that should be marked... what’s the issue?!

title: Florida lock and key
text: I am very disappointed in this company they charged me $175 to open an office door I have had to use locksmith too many times and this was one of the most expensive locksmith I have ever used I have always paid under $100. I would understand it if it was a hard job it took the technician 30 seconds to get in I would also understand if it was before 8 o’clock or after 9 o’clock at night it was 8:45 in the morning I will never use this company again and if anybody ever asked me I certainly would not recommend this. I called the company to talk to the owner instead I got a manager and they seemed like they didn’t care. I’m sorry if I was a small business owner I would certainly try to make my customer happy and to have them come back as repeat customers. They really need to work on their customer service and let the customer know the prices before hand not slap them with a outrageous bill.

title: Unreliable and unsafe for marginalized people
text:
The walking directions are not written out when combined with public transit directions which makes it difficult for hearing impaired people. The directions can also be inaccurate and lead to people who already struggle with physical disabilities to get lost and suffer not because of their abilities, but because of oversight by developers. Situations can be exacerbated by weather for example— for my condition— my joints pop out easily and it causes pain that disrupts what I want to do. I also am more at risk for fainting and suffer from GI issues. Getting redirected after there were not enough shuttle buses during a repair phase for our local system had me lost because of inaccurate map directions. I was carrying heavy groceries in hot weather and it hurt my muscles and joints. 

Public transit timing directions have not been reliable for months. People who must depend on public transit because they are low income then have more chances of being late to work, appointments, etc.

title: It’s ok-
text: It’s very buggy even when you have good signal and will re route you if it senses any traffic even hours away that will be cleared before you even get to that point. Seems to favor expensive gas stations in the area. Will give you the slowest route, even if you can turn one time and drive right into the place you’re going to, it will take you through side roads that may take hours longer than it seems to, going the other way. One route may say it only takes 5 minutes to your destination and one may say 30 minutes. If you click the one that says 5 minutes it sometimes will still take you the other way. I got lost one time because it kept re routing me through country side roads and I had no idea where I was. We tried to get it to route us back even to a restaurant but it didn’t work out so I had to get a hold of a friend to come and show me the way because this app didn’t work. Still one of the better direction apps but too buggy to trust it. Thanks!

title: About as useful as a map
text:
It’s a map. It shows you where stuff is. Unlike a paper map, it can sometimes show you real time information about a place. Sometimes. Often, that information is wrong, because it’s sourced from other randos just like you. 

OTOH it is almost impossible to find the names of the streets it’s showing you; routing directions do not care about human concerns and will happily send you down an unpaved, single lane dirt road if the algorithm thinks it is one second quicker than the interstate; and the search function has become infected with Google’s brain dead AI that knows you are definitely interested in every result that is a synonym of any word in your query - are you looking for “surgical clamps”, well here’s every place that offers medical services, and also every hardware store that sells clamps. You’re welcome.

As a map, it’s fine. As a smart phone app in 2023, it’s pathetic. But hey, at least it has plenty of room for ad placement, and that’s really the most important thing.

title: Pretty Good! Very helpful..One problem though
text:
I like using this app for traveling. But is there a way to turn off the setting where it automatically changes your route without your permission while you’re driving? As I was learning the routes in my state, I was struggling a lot with this app because I had picked a certain route to avoid busy roads during rush hour and such, then it would change the route by itself. (for convenience I think, which is nice, but also a little dangerous! It’s a little scary having to pay attention to the road and to make sure my map doesn’t change at the same time) When this happens I have to pull over to change it back if I don’t have a passenger in the car. It’s not as much of a problem now that I know my way around my local area. But I still use this app frequently! Is there a way that a feature could be added to prevent unauthorized route changing if it hasn’t been added already?

Thank you for your time!

title: Highly recommend!
text: This company is amazing! I have never been through the roofing process but after a big storm it was time.  To start Klaus Roofing came highly recommended by my boss so of course I had to call them.  I set up an appointment with Tyler (aka Owen Wilson!) and he walked me through everything, he 100% eased my concerns and made himself available anytime I had a pop-up question.  Then there is Kevin, he quickly arranged for my roof to be tarped, then contacted me with the exact process of when supplies would be delivered and start time which was exactly when Tyler said it would happen.  Now on to Chuck and Tommy, those guys are absolutely awesome! They were very friendly and professional, they treated my home with such care as if  it was their own home.  They even took pictures of my yard decor so they could put it back exactly how I had it! I can not express strongly enough!

title: fix this app PLEASE
text: why is it 2023 and we still cannot customize the colors of lists. everything is blue so i need to individually click on every saved item to figure out where it is. when i look at the list there is no scroll bar, and it constantly glitches and exits the list or goes back to the top. when i pin directions they just disappear. as soon as i close the app or switch to another screen, if i have directions pulled up they disappear. when i click on different spots, half the time the reviews tab is missing. WHY cant i add multiple stops on transit. why can't i mix transit and walking, or driving and walking. there are SOOOO many features that i don't think would be difficult to implement that would greatly improve the quality of user experience so much. while it was annoying without these features, i could tolerate it, but now the app has just been so finicky lately it's extremely frustrating to use. i dont know what went wrong that it's crapped out so much but using google maps is now an annoying and detrimental experience. like do better

title: Used Google maps for years but I’m considering switching apps
text: I’ve used Google maps for years and for the most part it’s been reliable. But over time I’ve just found it to be less and less useful and more annoying. I’ll give a few examples. One of my biggest annoyances with this app is when it tells me to make a left onto a major, busy road without the help of a light. I’m not risking my life to save maybe a minute by trying to cut across multiple lanes of traffic in the middle of the day to make a left. Another example is telling me to get off a highway and go onto the side streets or service road in order to avoid traffic on the highway. It never saves me time by doing that! I always end up getting stuck in the local traffic and traffic lights. The final straw was when we got stuck on the highway while it was closed down and the app didn’t warn us! My in laws got home faster even though they left after we did and took almost the same route!

title: Works when other apps fail me
text:
I have had some good experiences with Google maps. First Apple Maps frequently cause me to have minor heart attacks due to sending me in directions I’m not asking to go.  One feature Google could benefit from though is the road conditions up dates as I drive Apple is better at that.  
However, I rented a car in Italy recently with a navigation system.  Early in our trip We ended up being forced off the Highway due to a collision and seemingly no way to get back on. I followed the directions on the cars nav system and it only made the issue worse. Coupled with the fact it was getting darker by the minute and we were lost in the Italian countryside, it was frustrating. Finally I turned on Google maps and I found my way back with ease.  We only used Google maps from that point forward for the remainder of the trip.

title: Bad substitute for a real standalone GPS like by Garmin
text:
Bad substitute for a real standalone GPS like by Garmin, and other professional GPS manufacturers:

Unstable. Sometimes crashes without warning.

Audio issues:
Sometimes the audio will not work through the Bluetooth but every other app on my phone works through the Bluetooth, or if I use the speaker it comes through my phone but when I’m driving that’s not loud enough 

Direction and lagging issues: 
Many times, the directions lag and do not give you time to actually make a turn on to a new street.

Interface issues:
Keep showing the lanes!   
When you’re just generally driving, they do not also show the lanes and they usually show you the lanes too late. And they do not show you immediately after you turn if you’re going to have to turn again until usually again, too late.

Please update this app!
Please add that it will also always show what the next turn is going to be - beyond the one that’s coming up - well in advance! 

Safety issues:
While it’s navigating please make it voice controlled. You’re all about that Google. 
Dangerous:
Because it makes it unsafe to try to find gas or food while you’re driving if you’re having to reach and touch the screen in order to do that you have to take your eyes off the road

title: STOP FORCING ZOOM!!
text:
Can someone on the maps team please have some putty on your users and stop forcing the zoom into the current location when you start a route. I would like to get an overview of where google is sending me and when I’m trying to zoom out, google maps keeps trying to zoom in. It is SO OBNOXIOUS. 

Also, please get rid of the response delay. It’s anointing AF that when I tap on X or the input field or whatever that it does not register. Seriously, it’s obnoxious!

Thirdly, please stop it with the obnoxious search results with a tiny map and a list that wastes a bunch of white space. Are you a mapping app or not. Try the whole mapping thing and let users pull up a list if they want. Only troubled people use lists instead of a map in a mapping app. 

Lastly, please stop trying to force the silly Explore tab/card on users or at least knock it off with the wasteful whist space of that silly, childish google design language. It takes up a good 25% of the screen, especially with the redundant “explored, drive, transit” bar. 

I get it, you are paid too much and really want to stay with google so you and your team keep making up ways of doing things differently when they were already great and don’t need to be changed, but when you’ve reached high levels of outcome achievements, guess what, the likelihood of making things worse instead of better increases exponentially with every introduced change.

title: No longer useful
text: This use to be the most important app on my phone. I remember how upsetting it was when apple removed it and replaced it with their terrible app. How things change. I’m road tripping actoss the SW and I find google maps to be far more frustrating than it’s worth. I actually HATE using it. 1st what is the point of having a map app when you can’t find a street’s name? If it’s not buried under countless business names (which probably pay a fee to advertise on your map), neighborhood names or worse the numerous Pop up windows denoting trip times (quite often you can’t find yourself on the map b/c your burried under a trip time ETA). Street names often never appear under everything else. I find myself zooming in & out or sliding up and down the entire length of a city street without it’s name ever appearing. Trying to use it at all when your in the car is now dangerous. I’m hoping with the new privacy setting that apple released they will someday come up with a setting that lets you block everything Google from my computers so that I can completely leave this company behind.

title: Ongoing problems that aren’t addressed
text: At Highway divisions there was always a very bad navigation instructions: it’ll tell you to stay on the same highway when you in fact need to go onto the other highway is going the opposite direction.  The driver needs to know ahead of time which highway they’re going on and doesn’t have a moment to check to see which highway there actually supposed to be on by that time they usually take them out one.  This has been going on ever since Google maps was available to use in my area this is particularly the case when you are going south on the 405 and there’s an interchange where the 22 diverges to the right and they will still tell you to stay left or vice versa when you need to go to 22. This is in Los Angeles California over in Garden Grove/ seal Beach/ Long Beach. Millions of people pass through each day.  I am a local and sometimes I don’t know which one I’m taking until I get to the intersection I always have to check to see which road I should be taking I’ve been here 37 years.

title: Not User Friendly
text: I use GoogleEarth Pro as my MAP as it is easier to use and configure than Google Maps. I do not need to see all the information Google Maps wants to show me, and in fact I find that it makes the me busy no look confusing. I do use Google Search to search for places I want to go to. But the maps show just to much information. Much of which is unnecessary and distracts from your search. But the quality of the map is excellent, it is the same map you get with Google Earth Pro. Which is my preference. I have also noted that the more “preference's” you check in settings, the harder the is map is to use. It is better to use Google search then use the map that is displayed with in your search results for a better experience. A map is tool. Google Earth Pro is a far better tool and you can do a lot more with it and adjust the settings better to fit your needs. The map will not give you accurate info nor photos. It chose an entirely different area than the one I needed and also entered correctly. Google Earth Pro is far superior. And trustworthy also.

title: This app is trying to do too much
text: Navigation shouldn’t be so difficult with extra information. I don’t wanna order food, I don’t care what anyone else is doing, I took driver’s ed, identifying where a stop sign or traffic light are not that important. I want to be able to get to point A to point B quickly, safely, with simple traffic status, and road labeling and traffic updates. Google maps is trying to be DoorDash, Yelp, my photo album, Facebook, Hangouts, my wallet, messages and FaceTime  etc. Either do icons or words not both. Minimize ads. Be consistent! Too many words and not enough Street labeling. Simplify information! Label one way streets clearly. Let me see my route so I can determine the best way to go. Google maps zooms too much I cannot customize the distance I want to see my route at. Give us an option to view how we want to see directions. Offering zoom at 100%, 80%, 50%, 30% etc. Remove the car icon, remove traffic lights, stop signs, instead add exits!Use pins for gas stations, restaurants, hotels, food. It’s too much scrolling when trying to be safe on the road.

title: Team Teller is the best!
text: I know with all of the recent events, including the tornadoes, viruses, and economic slump, many people may be thinking of rebuilding, investing, and buying (while interest rates are so low). I would highly recommend Team Teller. This group of professionals is so informed, hands-on, and efficient. Our family, including my two daughters, have bought 6 homes with their assistance. They are so easy to work with and will guide you through every step of the process. They really listen to your needs and exactly what you want and do their best to help you get your dream home. We never felt pressured at any point. They were so eager and at the same time patient to help us. At the end of it all, we felt more like family members than clients. The fact that we keep using and recommending them shows how comfortable they made us feel. Give them a call and see what they can do for you.

title: Good navigation with an annoying problem
text: I use this very often, but a lot of the time when I select a specific route to take, later when I’m driving it will say “we have found a faster route, if you would like to stay on your current route click no thanks” and if you don’t click no thanks it will change the route you selected to something else. For one, just because a route may be slightly faster doesn’t mean it’s a road I’d prefer to be on, there can be many reasons for this. Second, I shouldn’t be forced to click a button on my phone screen while I’m driving just to stay on the route that I chose, that’s very distracting and illogical. It should be “we have found a faster route, if you would like to follow this route click ok”. Also why does it assume I didn’t see the faster route already and decided I didn’t want to go on that route beforehand, does it think I’m stupid or something? Please fix this, it’s very annoying and just makes me want to use a different maps app.

title: Swipe to move in Street View needs to go.
text:
When in street view you swipe to both rotate the camera AND swipe to move down the street. Having one input do two different things is a bad idea and will of lead to the app taking the wrong action much to my frustration. I can’t tell you the number of times I’m trying to turn the camera and suddenly I’m down the street or I’m trying to go down the street and suddenly I’m looking up in the air or down at me feet and when I try to swipe back up it moves down the street. The experience is infuriating when your trying to navigate.

You need to remove the swipe to move "feature" and replace it with a different gesture (one that’s not already being used). Baring that at least give me the option to disable it as Street View is unusable in its current form without much frustration.

Ignoring Street View this is an amazing app. It’s my go to for so many things. However Street View was one of the defining features of Google Maps that made it first stand out from the competition so I consider this a really big deal.

title: Trust the human
text:
In the past, when Google would offer different options for how to get somewhere, it would honor my choice and take me on that route, even if it wasn’t the fastest. Now Google maps has decided that it knows better than me, and when I chose the slower, scenic route over the stressful highway, it spent the whole trip trying to redirect me to the highway because that was faster. It actually added an hour to my trip because I had to keep pulling over to reset it. And it’s incredibly dangerous to have people trying to figure out why directions keep changing when they’re driving 60+ mph. 

Also, I know ads are important to Google but there are so many businesses that show up now when I open the map that it can be nearly impossible to find road names. Maps are for directions. Make sure you’re getting the basic service down before adding all the extras. This app has gotten so bad that I’ve basically switched to Apple Maps and even occasionally an old school paper atlas.

title: Used to work
text:
I drive a lot for work - upwards of 35,000 miles per year. Saved waypoints (or Labels as google calls them) don’t work anymore. It used to be that I could save a location by GPS coordinate and give it a unique name - something meaningful to me - and it would direct me to that saved location. But now my saved labels only work if I go exactly the way Google tells me to…if at any point I make a wrong turn or something and have to get “re-routed” it will route me to whatever public location Google has saved that has a similar name in a similar location. 5 times in the last two weeks I’ve been rerouted to somewhere miles away from where I was trying to go because Google decided to search for some location based on my label’s name instead of just taking me to the GPS coordinates I had saved with that label. Extremely frustrating, not to mention costly with paying for extra gas and lost time.

So I’ll be switching to some other app

title: No option to stick to a route
text:
Overall, I absolutely love Google Maps. But one aspect is incredibly frustrating, and can sometimes even be dangerous. 

Let's say I type in my destination, and Maps gives me 2 routes to get there. I choose a route that keeps me on the interstate the whole way, but is 10 minutes slower than the other rout. In the middle of driving, Maps will update to the faster route, and without even realizing it I end up going on the route that, while faster, ends up being full of windy mountain roads and spotty phone service. 

Could you PLEASE work on a feature that lets you stay on the route you originally choose, and will not suggest or switch to other routes? I am very intentional about the routes I choose, and I don't want Google Maps to send me on a different one just because it determines it's faster. I've gotten into some pretty rough situations this way.

title: Suddenly really buggy
text:
I’ve used this app for years and found it very reliable. But two major problems occurred repeatedly this week. 1. It keeps directing me to a recent location rather than the new location I typed in. We recently drove cross country to LA. We were heading to an Airbnb, but I didn’t have the address initially, so I used Santa Monica Pier as a rough location. Once we got close and received the address, I stopped the original navigation, typed in the new address, and started following the guidance. We ended up back at the pier. This happened 3 times in a row. I had to give up and navigate manually. 

On another day, we were navigating to a location in San Diego. It gave me 3 route options, and I selected the most scenic rather than the fastest. The app informed me that there was a faster route and asked if I wanted to RE-route. I declined. It instantly asked again. I declined again. It kept asking until I canceled navigation. This happened again today in a different state. It’s very distracting to have to constantly look at the screen and try to cancel the alternate route.

title: I prefer google maps to all else
text:
However, waze has a leg up when it comes to reporting hazards and speed enforcement. For instance I love that I can now report vehicles on the shoulder, objects on the road, and speed traps, BUT I can’t thumb up or down other peoples reports. It mighty seem like a small thing, but that one interactive feature (along with an audible announcement) puts waze above google maps for most of my family and friends. 
It would be more user friendly if a banner popped up with upcoming reports along with a thumb up/down option. Also, why titled “speed trap?” Why not just “police?” Or to be more general “speed enforcement,” which would include both cops and speed devices. 
Also could there be an option for bad weather or road conditions? 
These are my thoughts for an update. Google maps is still my favorite navigation app and I defend it to my waze-loving family.

title: Fantastic package
text:
Google maps has been fantastic in regards to loading maps and not needing Cellular, Wi-Fi or Internet access of sort just like Waze works. The Waze app. is a great one for knowing what’s ahead of you and Waze will be route via satellite when you’re in different traffic situations such as traveling in Sicily as we are now and rerouting us through the back streets that he would never know they would exist to return to our destination in the middle of the night.

I like the way Google maps marks out the route like a regular map but when I do need to change or use Waze, just to have something different.
Google maps also has wonderful easy to read history another great features Such as locations of restaurants shops etc. what’s their gathering for Google Trips. It’s a beautiful package that Google is doing, and it works well and I have not seen any bugs with it.

title: Issue with the GPS... icon shows I’m driving in reverse!!!
text:
I enjoy using this app! It’s great, but ever since the update for CarPlay, there have been a few issues. The most annoying thing is when driving, my position shows up upside down or even facing to the left of right. I understand this has to do with the way the phone GPS may be facing, but when driving on an expressway, it makes no sense. It shows the map as if I’m driving backwards. You guys should have a setting if you are moving in one direction at a certain speed to default the map to move to the way the road is. The whole map moving is only useful if you are walking. Another issue I ran into was the app freezes when you try to input an address via voice. This happens not as much but still bad. 
All in all, you guys need to make a setting to disable the actual location we’re facing when driving and just figure out if we’re going up, down, left, or right then make the map follow that. If this doesn’t get fixed, i honestly don’t know if I will continue to use this app.

title: Review on Shane Gray.
text: Today Shane was at my home to do a Service Partner evaluation of my air conditioner.  He did a fantastic job!  He installed 10 feet of new drain pipe to replace the old drain pipe that was running uphill and clogged.  He suggested that an EZ-Trap and a Ceiling Saver Kit would be good items to have installed, especially the latter, because if the air conditioner in the attic leaked, then it could ruin the second floor ceiling and cause the ceiling to be replaced.  Shane was knowledgeable, well-informed about the products he was describing, with no high pressure to buy the products.  He made several good suggestions about the area around the outside air conditioner, and he was very friendly and polite.  I will request Shane Gray to do any servicing that needs to be done in the future, based on the great job he did today and because he now knows the air conditioner equipment in my home.  Thank You Very Much!

title: Needs work
text:
I don’t use google maps for driving or directions. Mostly because I end up getting lost whenever I use it as a navigation. The arrow don’t point in the right direction your facing and sometimes I’m on a different street than the one I’m on. Granted I’m using the app in Japan at the moment. Also as a note some freeways are above main highways, it would be nice if it detected that as well. 
Not everything is bad though, it is a good app if your looking up places and need to find out information on where you want to go. I’ve noticed that companies tend to update their hours of operation on this map more than others. 
One other thing is I wish I could edit the colors of my pins or change the icon for the saved list. It would really help me organizing the map that I’m saving. I do use it a lot and I’m hoping to update my rating and review to this. If you search online there are a ton of people wishing the pin and icon can be changed. I’m sure you guys can figure that feature out.

title: Viewing Lists on Map Too Limited
text:
Love that I can save places to lists, and show and hide each list from the general-purpose map. 

However, it is extremely frustrating that there is no way to go into a list and (only then, while viewing that list) temporarily see all the places I saved to that list on the map without having to do this:
- tell the app to show them in the map 
- return to the map
- try to pick them out amongst everything else I saved (unless I also manually go turn off those lists temporarily, which isn’t worth the trouble for 99% of the use cases I’m suggesting) 

In other words, unless I’ve missed something, you can only see lists in list view unless you adjust their visibility as bookmarks on your map. I don’t want that- I just want a way to see the list on the map through the list itself and then go back to the map with all my other settings unchanged. 

For example, some lists (like places to eat) I would like to always display on a daily basis. I leave those turned on. Other lists (like museums) I only get to use occasionally, so usually leave turned off so the map isn’t too crowded. That’s all fine. 

I get annoyed, however, when I go to the museums list, and want to quickly view only museums in the map, but cannot; to do so, I have to turn on that list and turn off 3-5 other normal lists first. This seems unnecessary and easy to fix, and would add a ton of  utility to an otherwise good app.

title: Works great on East Coast US but not so much when I’m anywhere else.
text: I use this all the time when at my parents’ place and it gives me plenty of notice for a turn and does an overall great job navigating in New York. I’ve been using it while at my grandparents’ in West Cost US and it tells me once I’m at the turn that I’m supposed to be turning (at which point I can’t turn) and in Japan it doesn’t register where you are when trying to walk places and get directions, and we ended up making wrong turns because the map would say we were two blocks from where we actually were. Overall I use this over Apple Maps any day but it’s getting to be annoying missing turns because I can’t look at the map while driving and it tells me only once I’m at the turn to actually turn. If I was more familiar with the area it wouldn’t be a problem but I’m only here about 1 week every year and I only just started driving here because I can’t rent a car so I have to be able to borrow a car.

title: Rollback (to like 10 versions back!!!)
text:
iphone 6s ios 10.
I get smooth performance for every app, except everything google now offers! Google maps has always been so much better than apple maps and all others as well. But all these 'Everyday' updates and bug fixes have made the app sluggish. I believe we all can live with a little less features if it means just getting that smoothness back! Almost 60% of the screen space is taken by all-that-i-don't-need when i open the app. i just need the map, my current location and my destination bar!! That's it! If we need anything else, or if you think we need anything else, then just give us those options in the side menu. You should realize that most people are still using those 5-6 inch devices and not the ipads. 40% screen is not good enough for the map! and yes, we can't all have an iphone X or a pixel 2 to just get rid with the laggy UI. Understand that you can't force us to buy devices we don't need, instead we will adapt to apple maps or something else if you can't be efficient.

title: Yacht getaways
text:
We took a cruise on a 52” catamaran and did the small Cyclades for a week. Our crew was Dal and Brie and I can’t say enough them!! Dal was our captain, calm cool and collected, and very experienced. We hit come strong winds and water for a few days, and he handled the boat like a pro. He made the experience thrilling , although we did get a little wet due to a few rogue waves . It was so warm out, it didn’t matter, and we were dry and heading into our sheltered bay in no time. 

Brie was also amazing, with here gourmet meals, and local knowledge of restaurants,  hiking and biking. She made our dining reservations and we hit the best spots on all our stops. She was also skilled as first mate , and could dive of the boat and tie us up 2 shore in lighting speed. Here bubbly personality gave her her nickname Breezy, and her and Dal were a seamless team. All in all , our destinations , food , boat and crew were all 5 star!!

title: Could be better
text: Google maps is always my “go-to” app for directions and traffic, but, it could be even better. My biggest gripe is that I can’t drag a route on the mobile app (on my iPhone) to get time or mileage estimates for a route I suspect will be better (because I KNOW my area’s traffic patterns-especially during rush hour times!) And choosing “avoid highways” or something else won’t help because I want a blend that includes both a )?highway then a back road. I love the drag feature on my desktop but why can’t it also be available on the mobile app? My next complaint is the inability to print directions directly from the app. My mother needs directions and being “older” (and without a smartphone, lol) she prefers having the  paper directions. If I want to do that for her, again, I have to boot up my laptop 😖 Please see if the app can incorporate these features that work so well on a desktop/laptop into the mobile app! 🙏

title: Wanted to like it but unreliable
text:
I almost never give “bad”reviews of something but I felt like I needed to share. I started using Google Maps more because I have been using lots of other Google apps and loved them like docs, tasks, calendar, etc. I liked them better than the Apple versions.
So I gave google
Maps a try on a recent weekend trip. I knew which highway I needed to use but I needed help closer to my destination. It seemed to be experiencing some kind of error. It kept telling me to turn somewhere not the usual once or twice reminder but repeatedly for a solid minute and a half. So I ignored it, got myself to the highway I knew I needed to be on and figured it would reroute or correct but it kept doing it! I had to have Siri download another directions app and use that while I was driving because this app couldn’t get it together. I thought surely, I had selected some sort of setting that made it do that but I haven’t found anything unusual. I’m a little nervous to use it again, honestly.

title: Paid advertisement
text:
Wanted to take mass transit to get to the zoo, and the top result had me get off the subway 4 stops early to take a Lyft — only indication that this was an advertisement was given after you opted into the directions and looked at the detailed itinerary. This was my favorite map app but i cannot abide by this craven and hollow method of advertisement.

Update: redownloaded this on a roadtrip - google maps ended up being great when we were in a car. But, I’m back in NYC, and every time I try to get directions using public transit, the map makes me go far out of my way on the subway and ends my trip with a Lyft ride. When i turn off the ‘ride share’ option for routing, the app can no longer find tenable public transit directions. It won’t even direct me 6 stops down a single subway line. When the “ride share” option turns itself back on, google is back to finding the right subway for me to take, but throws me so far out of the way that I’d need to take a Lyft, again.

This is so profoundly frustrating and absolutely kills the apps usefulness for me.

title: Stop changing my settings every time there’s an update
text:
Please stop changing my settings every time I update the app. I usually click update all and not look at what’s been updated. But I always know when google maps has been updated bc it almost causes an accident with each update. Stop it google. Don’t change my settings! 
Leave my settings alone. Most specifically, leave my true north setting off. Why are you always turning it back on?   I don’t like true north and always have it turned off. I always know there was an update to google maps bc I immediately get lost wondering why my map is different. 
Stop it! I chose you over Apple Maps. Please stop changing my settings. It can cause an accident when I have to quickly go to settings to turn off true north while I’m driving. 
Or at least immediately state what has changed when I open google maps. I don’t see it until I start driving. Annoying. And rude.
